column4: I just installed ubuntu and my X will not start up... can someone try and help me here
I am going to reboot
which video chipset?
did you follow http://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto ?
not yet, but I will
I'm not sure you want to.  I don't know if Rage Pro is supported with fglrx.  That's why I'm asking.
hmmm, another problem wiki points me to apt-get, but I have to configure my wireless still... grrrr
please don't follow that wiki page.  Rage Pro is not supported by fglrx.  nalioth pointed out that you likely want the VESA driver
ok, so just get the proper driver?? I dont understand why this happened, I used the live cd for 2 days and it detected the proper driver
the installer should have.  Can we please see your /etc/X11/xorg.conf?  Please paste it on pastebin
I am on a separate machine, winblows xp
okay
what command did you run?
I can go into the x11 directory and manually edit, if you help
trying to.  what were you doing with dpkg?
did you just install?  did it complete?
did it complete succesfully?
I did get one error that said it was unsuccessful, then it brought me to the main menu and I chose base install I think it was called
do you recall the error?
the base install completed ok and it then installed the grub ok
said something like not being able to completely install all the packages,"maybe a bad cd" is what it said
I figured it was my wireless network
it gave me the option to hit enter to continue
that does not sound good
it's probably a bad burn.  Make sur ethe CD image you have is good
first check its md5sum
I know K3B auto does that, but what about windows?
I don't use windows, and can't say.
that is very rare.  Something is likely wrong with your media.  ubuntu would not top distrowatch if it failed like that very often
no, that's a feature.
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RootSudo
did the md5sum not match?
I was on the ubuntu site, but they dont have the checksums posted
see the file named "MD5SUMS"
got it thanks
chesum matches.. could it be a setting in Nero that did it?? I remember switching to DAO instead of TAO
I suppose it's possible. Again, I don't use windows, and hence haven't used nero
I am reburning it right now
okay, good luck
ok installing ubuntu take 2!!
good luck, buddy :)
right away its asking me for my ESSID for my wifi
okay
it actually see's the card, but I dont know what to put here???
do you use an essid?
okay, leave it blank
ok, DHCP has failed cause I have to configure the wifi later, I have a menu here, should I choose do not configure network at this time?
how many wireless routers are in your proximity?
just the one?  It's yours?
can you drop to a virtual console, and verify you're seeing with iwlist please?
its not installed, Im on winblows remember?? heh
you're right.  Well, how important is getting networking configured right now rather than later?
okay, if you wish to proceed with the installation, go for it
that's fine.  You can install purely off CD
okay.  I won't be sticking around much longer, though.
okay, good luck to you :)
heya, good to see your still here... I've got problems
I'n back, haven't been here the whole time ;)
so what's up?
I will copy and paste in a PM for you ok?
ok
trying to get ubuntu to work, I hate giving up but the g/f is getting pissed at me not spending time away from the comp
I understand that.  What's the problem now?
btw, I lost that error cause the comp was in powersaver, I need to configure the video card... I cannot get into X
so X is still not getting configured right on install?
went through with no errors except the wifi configuration and DHCP
so no errors, but you still have no X?
right, but what I find strange is that the live cd works!!
so should the install CD.
is dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg still giving the same error?
something is going seriously wrong with your installations if that's the case
please first try "sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop"
I don't advise trying xfree86
I tried sudo apt-get and it told me to do apt-get -i
bizarre
bottom line is we need to get xserver-xorg installed
CORRECTION, it told me to do apt-get -f install
okay, that makes a little more sense, and confirms that something is going dreadfully wrong during your installation
after I did that it was unpacking stuff then open office had tar corruption
you're positive your installation media is good?
I reburned twice, unless the downloaded image is currupt?? also... I burned from Windows
if certain packages (e.g. openoffice) are corrupt, your install CD is hosed
did the "sudo apt-get install -f" complete?
no, did not complete, openoffice had tar corruption, it stopped
try "sudo dpkg --configure --pending" please
ok give me a min
finally, huh?
yeah!! thanks to you....
only in part :)
hows it going? I tried afew distros and came back to ubuntu :O)
glad you're back :)
I actually installed Kbuntu, and I now have problems installing additional software, synaptic is replaced with Knaptic and I cant update the repositories. I need to do some research
have you asked in #kubuntu ?
no, I'll head there now :)
okay.  :)
